name: CreditCard

aliases.name: CardData
aliases.comment:
Stores the card data such as number, name, etc.

This `CardData` can be embeded into your application's Model in various ways.
Here's 2 example of embedding this data into your model:
Example 1:

    -- Use CardData in your model directly
    type alias Model =
        { cardData : CreditCard.CardData {}
        ...
        }

    -- Initial the model
    init =
        { cardData = CardData.emptyCardData
        ...
        }

Example 2:

    -- Extends the CardData in your Model
    type alias Model =
        { number : Maybe String
        , name : Maybe String
        , month : Maybe String
        , year : Maybe String
        , cvv : Maybe String
        , state : CreditCard.State
        , shippingAddress : Maybe String
        ...
        }

    -- Initial the model
    init =
        let
            emptyCardData =
                CardData.emptyCardData
        in
            { emptyCardData |
            shippingAddress = Nothing
            ...
            }
aliases.type: { model | number : Maybe.Maybe String, name : Maybe.Maybe String, month : Maybe.Maybe String, year : Maybe.Maybe String, cvv : Maybe.Maybe String, state : CreditCard.State }

aliases.name: State
aliases.comment: Internal State of the card view

values.name: card
values.comment:
Card view

Render the card view individually.
Example:

    view model =
        let
            config =
                CreditCard.Config.defaultConfig
        in
        CreditCard.card config model
values.type: CreditCard.Config.Config config -> CreditCard.CardData model -> Html.Html msg

values.name: cvv
values.comment:
CVV form field

Render the CVV field individually.
Example:

    type Msg = UpdateCardData Model

    view model =
        let
            config =
                CreditCard.Config.defaultFormConfig UpdateCardData
        in
            form []
                [ CreditCard.card config model
                , CreditCard.cvv config [] model
                ...
values.type: CreditCard.Config.FormConfig model msg -> List (Html.Attribute msg) -> CreditCard.CardData model -> Html.Html msg

values.name: form
values.comment:
Form view

Render the card view with the full form fields.
Example:

    type Msg
        = UpdateCardData Model

    view model =
        let
            config =
                CreditCard.Config.defaultFormConfig UpdateCardData
        in
        CreditCard.card config model
values.type: CreditCard.Config.FormConfig model msg -> CreditCard.CardData model -> Html.Html msg

values.name: initialState
values.comment: Initial state of the card view

name: CreditCard.Events
comment:
Helpers function for all events related to focus/blur of CVV field for card flipping effects.
See examples in the demo folder of the git repo for some example on how to use this module.


# Events

@docs updateCVVFocus, onCVVFocus, onCVVBlur

values.name: onCVVBlur
values.comment:
`onBlur` event for the CVV field.
This will update the focus state of the cvv field to `False` in the internal state

values.name: onCVVFocus
values.comment:
`onFocus` event for the CVV field.
This will update the focus state of the cvv field to `True` in the internal state

values.name: updateCVVFocus
values.comment: Helper function to update the focus state of the cvv field in the internal state

name: CreditCard.Config

aliases.name: Config
aliases.comment:
Configuration for card view

  - `blankChar` : character used to render empty text in the card.
  - `blankName` : text used as placeholder for when the name is empty.
aliases.type: { config | blankChar : Char, blankName : String, class : String }

aliases.name: Form
aliases.comment: For all form related configuration (e.g.: classes, labels, etc)
aliases.type: { number : String , name : String , month : String , year : String , cvv : String }

aliases.name: FormConfig
aliases.comment:
Configuration for form view.

This includes all configuration from `Config` with addition of:

  - `onChange` : `Msg` function for updating `CardData`
  - `showLabel` : hide/show the label of each form field.
  - `classes` : classes of each form field's container, stored in a `Form` record.
  - `labels` : text of each form field's label, stored in a `Form` record.
  - `placeholders` : the placeholder text of form field, stored in a `Form` record.
aliases.type: { blankChar : Char , blankName : String , class : String , onChange : CreditCard.Internal.CardData model -> msg , showLabel : Bool , classes : CreditCard.Config.Form , labels : CreditCard.Config.Form , placeholders : CreditCard.Config.Form }

values.name: defaultClasses
values.comment:
Default classes name for form view

  - `number = "Number"`
  - `name = "Name"`
  - `month = "Month"`
  - `year = "Year"`
  - `cvv = "CVV"`

values.name: defaultConfig
values.comment:
Default configuration for card view

  - `blankChar = 'â€¢'`
  - `blankName = 'YOUR NAME'`

values.name: defaultFormConfig
values.comment:
Default configuration for form view
Requires a `Msg` function to update the `CardData`

  - `showLabel = True`
  - `classes =` See `defaultClasses`
  - `labels =` See `defaultLabels`
  - `placeholders =` See `defaultPlaceholders`

values.name: defaultLabels
values.comment:
Default label for form view

  - `number = "Number"`
  - `name = "Full Name"`
  - `month = "Month"`
  - `year = "Year"`
  - `cvv = "CVV"`

values.name: defaultPlaceholders
values.comment:
Default placeholder text for form view

  - `number = "Credit Card Number"`
  - `name = "First Last"`
  - `month = "MM"`
  - `year = "YY"`
  - `cvv = "CVV"`
